Pokemon GO Bug Out 2025 offers multiple Research tasks and Collection Challenges. The event debuts the Galar region’s Sizzlipede and Centiskorch. Completing the in-game content rewards valuable items and featured Pokemon encounters like Sizzlipede.

You can participate in the Bug Out 2025 event from Wednesday, March 26, at 10 AM Local Time until it ends on Sunday, March 30, at 8 PM Local Time . There is an event-exclusive Field Research quest, 2 Timed Research quests (free/paid), 3 Collection Challenges, and numerous bonuses. Since all the in-game content is event-exclusive, you must complete them before the event is over. Follow this guide to complete all the Pokemon GO Bug Out 2025 Research tasks, Collection Challenges, and rewards.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows Takes One of Assassin’s Creed 3’s Most Unique Features to New Heights
item.description:
Assassin's Creed Shadows has finally been released, and so far, it seems to be hitting all the right notes. Not only did it finally take the franchise to feudal Japan, but it has also elevated the RPG framework with a whole host of exciting changes. All of this has helped make it a fantastic adventure for fans, but there is one feature that really stands out among the crowd: its new dynamic seasons.

Assassin's Creed Shadows has taken seasons, expanded them immensely, and made them a core part of the actual gameplay loop. While previous entries have had weather effects, the last time seasons were a notable part of the series was back with Assassin's Creed 3 . Since then, Ubisoft has seemingly pulled away from the concept, but Shadows has once again made them an exciting part of the formula. And now that they are here, hopefully seasons will become a core part of the franchise going forward.

Assassin's Creed Shadows Has Injected New Life Into the Formula With Seasons

Assassin's Creed 3 Dabbled in the Concept of Seasons

One of the big additions that came with Assassin's Creed 3 was the new weather effects and seasonal changes that would change the way players approached the open-world. Unlike real life, there were only two seasons: summer and winter. In the summer, much of the game would play like how it did in past Assassin's Creed titles, with the addition of occasional fog or rain. In the winter, the land would be coated in thick snow, which would reduce visibility and help to improve stealth. Additionally, Connor would have to trek through large snow drifts and leave a path wherever he went.

The seasons would change throughout the story, and once players finished Assassin's Creed 3 , they could change it whenever they wanted. While it was not really a game-changer, this feature did help give the game a bit more of a lifelike feel. However, Ubisoft chose not to significantly expand upon it in future entries. The weather effects may have been carried over, and some areas of the future open-worlds featured things like snow, but the actual seasonal transitions were nowhere to be found. Luckily, that seems to finally be changing with Assassin's Creed Shadows .

Assassin's Creed Shadows Has Expanded Seasons Immensely

Assassin's Creed Shadows has once again taken on seasons, but this time around, they are drastically different. For starters, the seasonal change is now a core part of the gameplay loop. Each season is split up into two resets, which occur after a set amount of in-game time has passed. The first occurs at the middle of a season while the second occurs at the end, with the only major difference being that one ushers in a whole new season. With each reset, players get resources for their hideout, their scouts and areas on the map refresh, and new contracts appear. Additionally, alerts and local factions will also refresh. This gives players a largely clean slate, which is coupled by beautiful aesthetic changes.

Just like in the real-world, each of the four seasons features its own unique aesthetic for players to soak in. The colors of the leaves change, the vegetation dies or grows, animals emerge, and traversal can even be affected. Seasons also bring with them new hazards, hiding spots, and even some seasonal exclusive content in Assassin's Creed Shadows . All of this makes for a pretty exciting feature that shapes each playthrough in highly meaningful ways.

Injecting this type of seasonal system into Assassin's Creed Shadows has really helped make the entire experience far more lifelike. It's gripping to watch the land change and have the changing weather actually affect the way the game is played a bit. Now that Ubisoft has reintroduced them, hopefully it has no plans to move away from seasons again.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Skysplit Gembloom Locations & Farming Route
item.description:
Atocpan is a new area of Genshin Impact , released in version 5.5. With the new region, it is no surprise that Travelers will also be getting a new local specialty. One of the new materials around Atocpan is called Skysplit Gembloom, and players can find them near cracked ground around the volcano.

Skysplit Gembloom, like every other local specialty, will respawn 46 hours after it is harvested. Travelers who urgently need the plants can also visit another player's world and ask for the materials. A total of 168 Skysplit Gembloom is required to level up a character to the maximum in Genshin Impact .

Skysplit Gembloom Locations in Genshin Impact

Skysplit Gembloom is an exclusive local specialty for the Natlan region, specifically in Atocpan and Ancient Sacred Mountain. A total of 74 Skysplit Gemblooms can be farmed in the new map.

The first location you should go for farming these plants is near the lava pool by the waypoint northeast of Collective of Plenty in Genshin Impact . Once you arrive at the waypoint, head north, and you can immediately see the first two Skysplit Gemblooms. After that, turn around and walk along the cliffs near the pool to the next eight Skysplit Gemblooms.

Most of them are in patches near each other, so it's easy to spot them, but it will be better if you bring along a character that can mark the resources in Natlan on the mini-map, like Kinich.

The northwest of Collective of Plenty also has abundant Skysplit Gembloom, specifically around the pathway in Fallingstar Fields . After you use the waypoint in this area, three Skysplit Gemblooms can be seen on the southwest of Fallingstar Fields and another five on the northern side. Once you collect all of them, warp to the waypoint far northwest of Fallingstar Fields and head east towards a small space between the two mountains for another three Skysplit Gemblooms.

Afterward, use the teleport waypoint southwest of Remnants of Tetenanco and head west towards a hidden area guarded by Pulverite rocks . You can move past these rocks by destroying them using Tatankasaurus's sprinting, or jump across them using Yumkasaurus in Genshin Impact . In fact, you can also walk around the boulder beside the Pulverites to reach the area hidden inside. Collect five Skysplit Gemblooms in this area and climb upwards for another six of them.

There are some enemies in the lower area near the previous Pulverite rocks, and it's best to defeat them first before collecting these local specialties.

Another spot to harbor Skysplit Gembloom in Atocpan is near the waypoint far west of Remnants of Tetenanco . Two of them can be found on the south side near a platform, while the remaining five are on the north.

Far southwest of Atocpan is a small island that can be reached by indwelling a Koholasaurus near the shore of the new artifact domain called Derelict Masonry Dock. After activating the waypoint on this island, two Skysplit Gembloom can be seen on the east of the waypoint, while another eight of them are planted near each other by the coast.

Once you collect every Skysplit Gembloom in Genshin Impact's Atocpan, you can move to Ancient Sacred Mountain. This map can be unlocked after you start the Chronicler of the Crumbling City Quest Chain, starring the little Tepetlisaurus. There, warp to the waypoint northeast of Sea of Shifting Sentience and turn around for two Skysplit Gemblooms. Then, walk across the bridge for the next three of this plant. Afterwards, keep heading northeast for the last three Skysplit Gembloom in this area.

Now, teleport to a waypoint southeast of the Sea of Shifting Sentience . The Skysplit Gemblooms in this location are near each other, so as long as you can keep an eye out on the road, you can see each plant around the area.

The last spot to harvest Skysplit Gembloom in Genshin Impact is in the Flame-Melding Ritual Grounds. Warp to the waypoint west of this island to find three Skysplit Gemblooms in the area. Afterward, follow the path towards the center of the island for another six of these local specialties.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leaks Cipher's Complete Kit
item.description:
Summary

  • Upcoming Honkai: Star Rail character, Cipher, is a Nihility Quantum user with a kit centered around debuffs.
  • Cipher's kit includes effects like Foretold and Wealth Bond, with abilities like Basic ATK and Stealth.
  • Cipher is expected to be released in the second part of update 3.3, following Hyacine's announcement.

A new Honkai: Star Rail leak has revealed the complete kit details for one of the upcoming characters, the new Nihility Quantum user, Cipher. Honkai: Star Rail 's official social media accounts recently revealed Cipher's official splash art, confirming that this character will join the roster in update 3.3.

The announcement took many fans by surprise, considering that it's fairly early for HoYoverse to officially announce new characters, especially since the second part of update 3.1 is not over yet. Honkai: Star Rail has previously confirmed two new playable units that will appear in the upcoming update 3.2: Castorice and Anaxa.

An interesting post on the Honkai: Star Rail subreddit has revealed the complete details of Cipher's on-field kit. The official storyline confirms that Cipher is one of the Chrysos Heirs, a group of powerful individuals who rose after the Titans of Amphoreus fell. At the moment, only eight of the Chrysos Heirs are known, with the upcoming five-star character Castorice also being one of them. Many fans suspect that Cipher's design was inspired by Pardofelis from Honkai Impact 3 , which wouldn't come as a big surprise since HoYoverse often bases its character designs on previous playable units from its other titles. The fact that Cipher is a Nihility character in Honkai: Star Rail suggests that she will rely on applying debuffs. According to the leak, her kit revolves around two important effects: Foretold and Wealth Bond.

Honkai: Star Rail: Cipher's Kit Explained

  • Basic ATK – Deals Quantum damage equal to a percentage of Cipher's ATK to a single enemy target in Honkai: Star Rail .
  • Talent – At the start of an ally's turn, if no enemy is under the Foretold effect, Cipher inflicts it on a random enemy, prioritizing the target with the highest HP.
  • Skill – Inflicts the Foretold effect, which deals Quantum damage scaling with Cipher's ATK. The effect deals damage to the selected target and its adjacent enemies.
  • Ultimate – Cipher deals Quantum damage to a single enemy before dealing True damage equal to the value of the Wealth Bond effect, which is distributed among the target and its nearby enemies.

If an ally deals damage to an enemy affected by Foretold, Cipher will enter the Wealth Bond state. Cipher also has an interesting Technique effect in Honkai: Star Rail that allows her to enter Stealth, increasing her movement speed and automatically collecting treasures when passing by. Upon entering battle, she will deal damage to all enemies and record the damage in Wealth Bond.

Cipher’s signature Light Cone in Honkai: Star Rail will increase CRIT Rate. If the user deals damage with their Skill, it will lower the enemy's defense. This effect increases if the attack turns out to be a CRIT Hit. Regarding Cipher's release date, considering that she was announced after Hyacine, players can expect her to arrive in the second part of Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.3.

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy: How to Increase Your Beast Species Limit
item.description:
Summary

  • Increasing beast species limit in Hogwarts Legacy requires unlocking additional Vivariums by completing quests.
  • Each Vivarium can hold up to 4 different species, with a maximum of 16 species across all 4 Vivariums.
  • Expanding your beast species limit allows for breeding, faster earning, and more resource drops for gear upgrades.

Although the taming and breeding of beasts in Hogwarts Legacy is an engaging and interesting mechanic, the developers do not necessarily fully explain certain aspects and nuances, which raises various questions. One is the problem with increasing the beast species limit in Vivarium because you essentially have to figure out how to do it yourself.

Fortunately, for players looking to increase their collection of the fantastical beasts and creatures you can find in Hogwarts Legacy , there is a way to increase the number of occupants in your Vivarium. Instead of finding out for yourself, we've saved you some time and prepared a guide that will tell you how to increase your beast species limit in Hogwarts Legacy .

Updated March 26, 2025, by Gemma Johnson: There are numerous species of magical creatures you can catch and care for in Hogwarts Legacy. However, there is only so much space in your Vivariums, with a maximum beast species limit within each one. If you've caught a lot of beasts and different species, you might wonder how to increase your beast species limit in Hogwarts Legacy and how to get more beast space. While beast storage space in the game is somewhat limited regarding Vivarium upgrades and doesn't necessarily tell you everything, there are ways you can get a bit more space if you're struggling to home all of your creatures. This guide adds further information about increasing your beast species limit in Hogwarts Legacy and details the benefits of getting more Vivarium space.

How to Increase Vivarium Beast Species Limit in Hogwarts Legacy

While Vivariums in Hogwarts Legacy 's Room of Requirement give a lot of ground for your creatures to roam, unfortunately, there are some limitations when it comes to animal and species capacity. In Hogwarts Legacy, although one Vivarium can hold as many as 12 animals, it can only house a maximum of four species with no way to increase the beast species limit of each individual Vivarium.

Therefore, if you have already caught more species than, for example, a Puffskein, Mooncalf, Fwooper, and Graphorn, you can only store up to four different species in a single Vivarium, so you'll have to choose which four beast species you want to include. If you try to store more species than the maximum number of four, you'll need to make more space using other methods, as per the on-screen notification that appears if you try to add more, as below, which suggests selling them to free up space:

Fortunately, there is a solution beyond just selling creatures to make more space for different creatures. If the number of species you have found and want to tame is more than the space in your Vivarium, don't worry, because there is one effective method you can use to work around this obstacle. While you can't expand your maximum Vivarium beast species limit within individual Vivariums, increase their individual overall animal capacity, or modify them further in terms of storage, you can unlock more Vivariums instead to get around this problem and store additional species.

In total, you can unlock four Vivariums in the Room of Requirement by progressing through various main and side quests in Hogwarts Legacy . Doing so enables you to tame and store more kinds of beasts, expanding your beast species limit to a maximum of 16 species across all four Vivariums , which are known as the Default Vivarium (Forest) , Swamp , Coastal , and Grassland Meadow/Mountain Vivariums , as pictured below:

Hogwarts Legacy Vivarium Unlock Requirements

Fortunately, the requirements to unlock more Vivariums in Hogwarts Legacy aren't overly complicated, as you need to progress in the game and complete certain quests. Each Vivarium is unlocked after completing a related quest, which can be a main or side quest. The table below lists all the Vivariums you can unlock in Hogwarts Legacy , the specific quests you have to complete to unlock them, plus how much animal capacity and species limit each provides:

The Plight of the House-Elf

It can take time to unlock all of Hogwarts Legacy's Vivarium biomes, but you might not find and tame all the species before unlocking the fourth Vivarium, which is the Mountain/Grassland Meadow Vivarium. If you find yourself in a situation where a new species you catch is much better than any of the ones you have in Vivarium, there are some ways to make room if you are happy to part with some of your creatures. Firstly, you can sell your animals at Brood and Peck, where you can purchase handy beast resources like Fwooper Fathers. Alternatively, you can release any animals you catch back into the wild from the Beast Inventory menu, which is irreversible.

Benefits of Increasing Beast Species Limit in Hogwarts Legacy And Beast Drops

Increasing your beast species limit and animal capacity by acquiring more Vivariums in Hogwarts Legacy can have several benefits, in addition to being able to store more species at any one time. If you enjoy breeding animals in the game, it's a handy way to earn money fast in Hogwarts Legacy . More Vivariums means you have extra space to store, breed, and sell more animal species, which is a great way to accumulate more gold in the game.

For some players, one of the best ways to take advantage of this is to set aside a separate Vivarium for breeding and place three animals of four species in it, ensuring you include a male and a female of each species. Place a female and a male of the same species in a breeding pen and wait for the result. From a total of 13 species in Hogwarts Legacy , it's also important to note that the only species you cannot breed is the Phoenix because there is only one in the game as a one-of-a-kind, unique creature.

Having different species across four Vivariums also gives you quick access to more beast resource drops at any one time, helping you farm more animal resources. When you care for creatures in Hogwarts Legacy by brushing or feeding them, they can drop resources to upgrade and add Traits to gear using the Enchanted Loom.
